titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Carrie Jette Johnson scrapbook
titlestmt.author: Daniel Hartwig

publicationstmt.publisher: Department of Special Collections and University Archives
publicationstmt.p: Copyright Â© 2015 The Board of Trustees of the Leland Stanford Junior University. All rights reserved.

note.p: This encoded finding aid is compliant with Stanford EAD Best Practice Guidelines, Version 1.0.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit

did.head: Overview
did.abstract: This scrapbook primarily concerns her high school life in Pacific Grove, California, her student years at Stanford University, and social events in Monterey and San Francisco. Included are programs, dance cards, clippings, invitations, calling cards, menus, valentine cards, academic notices, receipts and bills; many of the pages are annotated. Of note are items pertaining to social events in the women's dorm at Stanford; notes from a palm reading done on Johnson and three friends, Feb. 14, 1909; map of Palo Alto, 1909; an issue of the Mount Lowe Daily News, ca. 1911; and two stereographs of California scenery by C. W. J. Johnson, ca. 1880.

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Department of Special Collections and University Archives

accessrestrict.head: Information about Access
accessrestrict.p: This collection is open for research.

userestrict.head: Ownership & Copyright
userestrict.p: All requests to reproduce, publish, quote from, or otherwise use collection materials must be submitted in writing to the Head of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, California 94304-6064. Consent is given on behalf of Special Collections as the owner of the physical items and is not intended to include or imply permission from the copyright owner. Such permission must be obtained from the copyright owner, heir(s) or assigns. See: http://library.stanford.edu/depts/spc/pubserv/permissions.html.
Restrictions also apply to digital representations of the original materials. Use of digital files is restricted to research and educational purposes.

prefercite.head: Cite As
prefercite.p: Carrie Jette Johnson Scrapbook (SC0743). Department of Special Collections and University Archives, Stanford University Libraries, Stanford, Calif.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical Sketch
bioghist.p: Carrie Jette Johnson earned her A.B. in history at Stanford University in January 1912. She went on to become part owner and superintendent of The Muldoon School in Palo Alto, CA.

scopecontent.head: Description of the Collection
scopecontent.p: This scrapbook primarily concerns her high school life in Pacific Grove, California, her student years at Stanford University, and social events in Monterey and San Francisco. Included are programs, dance cards, clippings, invitations, calling cards, menus, valentine cards, academic notices, receipts and bills; many of the pages are annotated. Of note are items pertaining to social events in the women's dorm at Stanford; notes from a palm reading done on Johnson and three friends, Feb. 14, 1909; map of Palo Alto, 1909; an issue of the Mount Lowe Daily News, ca. 1911; and two stereographs of California scenery by C. W. J. Johnson, ca. 1880.
